[4:55 pm](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/addressing-gazans-idf-general-promises-boosted-aid-tents-ahead-of-expanded-offensive/)

#### [Addressing Gazans, IDF general promises boosted aid, tents ahead of expanded offensive](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/addressing-gazans-idf-general-promises-boosted-aid-tents-ahead-of-expanded-offensive/)

By [Stav Levaton](https://www.timesofisrael.com/writers/stav-levaton/ "Stav Levaton")

[![Displaced Palestinians flee Gaza City toward the southern areas of the Gaza Strip, in Nuseirat, on August 28, 2025. (Andrew Caballero-Reynolds/AFP)

During yesterday’s [White House meeting](https://www.timesofisrael.com/blair-and-kushner-join-trumps-gaza-meet-official-calls-it-a-simple-policy-session/)
 on the future of Gaza, US President Donald Trump called Strategic Affairs Minister Ron Dermer into the meeting while it was already in progress to set out Israel’s needs for the “day after” Hamas, Channel 12 reports.

Dermer, a top confidante of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, told Trump that Israel does not want to permanently occupy the Gaza Strip or deport Gaza’s residents, according to the report. Israel will continue to ensure that these gains are not eroded and that the security of the residents of the north is safeguarded,” he continues.

The Foreign Ministry adds that ahead of the Security Council discussion on UNIFIL, it “coordinated interagency preparations together with the IDF and the National Security Council,” and held talks with “key international partners,” in efforts it claims led to the decision to end UNIFIL’s mandate.

Israel’s Ambassador to the UN, Danny Danon, celebrates the “good news” in a video message, saying UNIFIL “has failed in its mission and allowed Hezbollah to become the region’s most serious threat.”

“The Lebanese government now needs to take responsibility and ensure that no other force is present on its border with Israel,” he adds.

The mandate is set to formally expire in December 2026, with UNIFIL troops scheduled to withdraw from Lebanon during 2027.

While Israel had pushed for the observer force’s mandate to be terminated even sooner, arguing it had not sufficiently acted against Hezbollah in southern Lebanon, its ally the US ultimately joined the rest of the Security Council in backing UNIFIL remaining in Lebanon for another year.

Share

[7:42 pm](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/netanyahu-says-idf-operating-in-syria-because-he-knows-who-were-dealing-with/)

#### [Netanyahu says IDF operating in Syria because he ‘knows who we’re dealing with’](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/netanyahu-says-idf-operating-in-syria-because-he-knows-who-were-dealing-with/)

By [Lazar Berman](https://www.timesofisrael.com/writers/lazar-berman/ "Lazar Berman")

[![Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu meets Druze leaders in Julis on August 28, 2025. (Amos Ben Gershom/GPO)")](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/netanyahu-says-idf-operating-in-syria-because-he-knows-who-were-dealing-with/)

Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu meets Druze leaders in Julis on August 28, 2025. (Amos Ben Gershom/GPO)

Visiting the war room set up by Israeli Druze to aid their co-religionists in Syria, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu says he ordered the use of military force in Syria because he is “not a naive person.”

“I understand who we are dealing with, what we are dealing with, and that is why we used force,” he says during a visit to the Druze town of Julis in northern Israel. (Emanuel Fabian/Times of Israel)

Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s office denies as “fake news” a report by the Kan public broadcaster that Israel seriously considered ceding the Mount Dov area in exchange for Syria giving up its claim to the Golan Heights in security talks with Damascus weeks ago.

“The claim that Israel supposedly considered handing over Mount Dov is absolute fake news,” the PMO says in response to the report.

The report concerned the Mount Dov region, an area on the Golan’s border also known as the Shebaa Farms, which is claimed by Israel, Lebanon and Syria.

According to Kan, Israel examined the possibility of transferring the area in return for Damascus suspending its sovereignty claim to the Golan, which Israel captured in the 1967 Six Day War and later annexed. (ANWAR AMRO / AFP)
    
*   [![Displaced Palestinians evacuate Gaza City toward the southern areas of the Gaza Strip, in Nuseirat, on August 28, 2025.(Eyad BABA / AFP)](https://static-cdn.toi-media.com/www/uploads/2025/08/AFP__20250828__72P38F6__v1__HighRes__PalestinianIsraelConflictGaza-e1756381972138-1024x640.jpg "Displaced Palestinians evacuate Gaza City toward the southern areas of the Gaza Strip, in Nuseirat, on August 28, 2025.(Eyad BABA / AFP)")](https://static-cdn.toi-media.com/www/uploads/2025/08/AFP__20250828__72P38F6__v1__HighRes__PalestinianIsraelConflictGaza-e1756381972138.jpg)

[10:57 pm](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/netanyahu-condemns-heinous-vandalism-outside-idf-chiefs-home/)

#### [Netanyahu, Katz condemn ‘heinous’ vandalism outside IDF chief’s home](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/netanyahu-condemns-heinous-vandalism-outside-idf-chiefs-home/)

Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu condemns [the vandalism](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/anti-war-protesters-arrested-for-pouring-red-paint-outside-idf-chiefs-house/)
 earlier today outside the home of IDF Chief of Staff Lt. (Peter Dejong/AP)

Another accuser has come forward alleging sexual misconduct by International Criminal Court chief prosecutor Karim Khan.

In a [report from](https://www.theguardian.com/law/2025/aug/28/second-woman-accuses-icc-chief-prosecutor-karim-khan-of-sexual-misconduct)
 the Guardian, an unnamed woman who worked for Khan in 2009 said that he “behaved inappropriately, subjecting her to unwanted sexual advances, abused his authority over her, and repeatedly sought to pressure her into sexual activity.”

She described his behavior as a “constant onslaught” of advances.

Khan, who was responsible for pursuing ICC arrest warrants against Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and former defense minister Yoav Gallant, temporarily stepped aside from his role earlier this year after other allegations emerged of sexual misconduct in the past two years.

His associates have tried to paint the allegations as a pro-Israel smear campaign, although the Guardian says there is “no evidence” of such a plot.

# Record
## Claim

## Web Sources

From [Source](https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/c1mpg2glz1zo): 
Content: The BBC News article, published on August 8, 2025, discusses Israel's plan to take control of Gaza City. <image:5340>, <image:5341>, <image:5343>. The plan has been condemned by several world leaders and the UN, who warn it would lead to "more massive forced displacement" and "more killing". Hamas warned of "fierce resistance" to the move. The article mentions that Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu told Fox News that Israel planned to occupy the entire Gaza Strip and eventually "hand it over to Arab forces".


From [Source](https://www.pbs.org/newshour/world/netanyahu-defends-military-expansion-in-gaza-and-lashes-out-at-global-campaign-of-lies):

The article mentions Netanyahu's statements about the war, including his goal to "free Gaza" and his blaming of Hamas for Gaza's problems. The article also includes an image of Netanyahu at a press conference in Jerusalem <image:5346>.

Content: The Times of Israel published a live blog on August 28, 2025. It includes:
*   A report on a White House meeting on the future of Gaza, where US President Donald Trump called Strategic Affairs Minister Ron Dermer into the meeting. Dermer told Trump that Israel does not want to permanently occupy the Gaza Strip or deport Gaza’s residents.

The article mentions that Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu told Fox News that Israel planned to occupy the entire Gaza Strip and eventually "hand it over to Arab forces" (<image:5340>, <image:5341>, <image:5343>).

PBS News published an article on August 10, 2025, discussing Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's defense of a military offensive in Gaza (<image:5346>). The Times of Israel's live blog from August 28, 2025, reports on a White House meeting where it was stated that Israel does not want to permanently occupy the Gaza Strip or deport Gaza’s residents. The live blog also mentions Netanyahu meeting with Druze leaders and his order to use military force in Syria.

DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "During his visit to the White House in April 2025 Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu announced plans to resettle Palestinians in Gaza to Ukraine and Syria."

## Actions
```
web_search("Benjamin Netanyahu White House April 2025")
web_search("Benjamin Netanyahu Gaza Palestinians Ukraine Syria")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
Benjamin Netanyahu met with Donald Trump at the White House on April 7, 2025, according to reports from NPR ([https://www.npr.org/2025/07/07/g-s1-76296/israel-netanyahu-meet-trump](https://www.npr.org/2025/07/07/g-s1-76296/israel-netanyahu-meet-trump)) and ABC7 ([https://abc7.com/post/trump-netanyahu-may-take-victory-lap-iran-gaza-war-looms-meeting/17007239/](https://abc7.com/post/trump-netanyahu-may-take-victory-lap-iran-gaza-war-looms-meeting/17007239/)). The meetings focused on the war in Gaza and potential ceasefire deals.

The Soufan Center published an Intelbrief on April 9, 2025, discussing Netanyahu's visit, focusing on Trump's tariffs, negotiations with Iran, and Türkiye-Israel relations ([https://thesoufancenter.org/intelbrief-2025-april-9/](https://thesoufancenter.org/intelbrief-2025-april-9/)). The Intelbrief does not mention any plans to resettle Palestinians in Gaza to Ukraine and Syria. <image:5288>, <image:5289>, <image:5295>, <image:5302>


### Evidence from `web_search`
The BBC News article from August 8, 2025, discusses Israel's plan to take control of Gaza City, which has been condemned by world leaders and the UN. The article mentions that Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu told Fox News that Israel planned to occupy the entire Gaza Strip and eventually "hand it over to Arab forces" (<image:5340>, <image:5341>, <image:5343>).

PBS News published an article on August 10, 2025, discussing Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's defense of a military offensive in Gaza (<image:5346>). The Times of Israel's live blog from August 28, 2025, reports on a White House meeting where it was stated that Israel does not want to permanently occupy the Gaza Strip or deport Gaza’s residents. The live blog also mentions Netanyahu meeting with Druze leaders and his order to use military force in Syria.


# Your Analysis



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The evidence indicates that Benjamin Netanyahu met with Donald Trump at the White House in April 2025. However, the provided sources do not mention any plans to resettle Palestinians in Gaza to Ukraine and Syria during this visit.

Later reports from August 2025 discuss Israel's plans for Gaza, including taking control of Gaza City and eventually handing it over to Arab forces. The Times of Israel reported that Israel does not want to permanently occupy the Gaza Strip or deport its residents.

Therefore, the claim is not supported by the evidence.

_________________________



JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "During his visit to the White House in April 2025 Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu announced plans to resettle Palestinians in Gaza to Ukraine and Syria."

## Actions
```
web_search("Benjamin Netanyahu White House April 2025")
web_search("Benjamin Netanyahu Gaza Palestinians Ukraine Syria")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
Benjamin Netanyahu met with Donald Trump at the White House on April 7, 2025, according to reports from NPR ([https://www.npr.org/2025/07/07/g-s1-76296/israel-netanyahu-meet-trump](https://www.npr.org/2025/07/07/g-s1-76296/israel-netanyahu-meet-trump)) and ABC7 ([https://abc7.com/post/trump-netanyahu-may-take-victory-lap-iran-gaza-war-looms-meeting/17007239/](https://abc7.com/post/trump-netanyahu-may-take-victory-lap-iran-gaza-war-looms-meeting/17007239/)). The meetings focused on the war in Gaza and potential ceasefire deals.

The Soufan Center published an Intelbrief on April 9, 2025, discussing Netanyahu's visit, focusing on Trump's tariffs, negotiations with Iran, and Türkiye-Israel relations ([https://thesoufancenter.org/intelbrief-2025-april-9/](https://thesoufancenter.org/intelbrief-2025-april-9/)). The Intelbrief does not mention any plans to resettle Palestinians in Gaza to Ukraine and Syria. <image:5288>, <image:5289>, <image:5295>, <image:5302>


### Evidence from `web_search`
The BBC News article from August 8, 2025, discusses Israel's plan to take control of Gaza City, which has been condemned by world leaders and the UN. The article mentions that Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu told Fox News that Israel planned to occupy the entire Gaza Strip and eventually "hand it over to Arab forces" (<image:5340>, <image:5341>, <image:5343>).

PBS News published an article on August 10, 2025, discussing Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's defense of a military offensive in Gaza (<image:5346>). The Times of Israel's live blog from August 28, 2025, reports on a White House meeting where it was stated that Israel does not want to permanently occupy the Gaza Strip or deport Gaza’s residents. The live blog also mentions Netanyahu meeting with Druze leaders and his order to use military force in Syria.


## Elaboration
The evidence indicates that Benjamin Netanyahu met with Donald Trump at the White House in April 2025. However, the provided sources do not mention any plans to resettle Palestinians in Gaza to Ukraine and Syria during this visit.

Later reports from August 2025 discuss Israel's plans for Gaza, including taking control of Gaza City and eventually handing it over to Arab forces. The Times of Israel reported that Israel does not want to permanently occupy the Gaza Strip or deport its residents.

Therefore, the claim is not supported by the evidence.


# Your Judgement



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The available evidence does not support the claim that Benjamin Netanyahu announced plans to resettle Palestinians in Gaza to Ukraine and Syria during his April 2025 visit to the White House. While the visit did occur, and discussions about Gaza were ongoing, no sources mention such a plan.

`false`

* Be truthful, brief, do not add any additional information besides the information given in the Record. 
* Link key sources in your summary. Use Markdown notation for that. You may link them in-line.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "During his visit to the White House in April 2025 Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu announced plans to resettle Palestinians in Gaza to Ukraine and Syria."

## Actions
```
web_search("Benjamin Netanyahu White House April 2025")
web_search("Benjamin Netanyahu Gaza Palestinians Ukraine Syria")
```

## Evidence

Benjamin Netanyahu met with Donald Trump at the White House on April 7, 2025, according to reports from NPR ([https://www.npr.org/2025/07/07/g-s1-76296/israel-netanyahu-meet-trump](https://www.npr.org/2025/07/07/g-s1-76296/israel-netanyahu-meet-trump)) and ABC7 ([https://abc7.com/post/trump-netanyahu-may-take-victory-lap-iran-gaza-war-looms-meeting/17007239/](https://abc7.com/post/trump-netanyahu-may-take-victory-lap-iran-gaza-war-looms-meeting/17007239/)). The meetings focused on the war in Gaza and potential ceasefire deals.

The Soufan Center published an Intelbrief on April 9, 2025, discussing Netanyahu's visit, focusing on Trump's tariffs, negotiations with Iran, and Türkiye-Israel relations ([https://thesoufancenter.org/intelbrief-2025-april-9/](https://thesoufancenter.org/intelbrief-2025-april-9/)). The Intelbrief does not mention any plans to resettle Palestinians in Gaza to Ukraine and Syria. <image:5288>, <image:5289>, <image:5295>, <image:5302>


### Evidence from `web_search`
The BBC News article from August 8, 2025, discusses Israel's plan to take control of Gaza City, which has been condemned by world leaders and the UN. The article mentions that Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu told Fox News that Israel planned to occupy the entire Gaza Strip and eventually "hand it over to Arab forces" (<image:5340>, <image:5341>, <image:5343>).

PBS News published an article on August 10, 2025, discussing Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's defense of a military offensive in Gaza (<image:5346>). The Times of Israel's live blog from August 28, 2025, reports on a White House meeting where it was stated that Israel does not want to permanently occupy the Gaza Strip or deport Gaza’s residents. The live blog also mentions Netanyahu meeting with Druze leaders and his order to use military force in Syria.


## Elaboration
The evidence indicates that Benjamin Netanyahu met with Donald Trump at the White House in April 2025. However, the provided sources do not mention any plans to resettle Palestinians in Gaza to Ukraine and Syria during this visit.

Later reports from August 2025 discuss Israel's plans for Gaza, including taking control of Gaza City and eventually handing it over to Arab forces. The Times of Israel reported that Israel does not want to permanently occupy the Gaza Strip or deport its residents.

Therefore, the claim is not supported by the evidence.


## Final Judgement
The available evidence does not support the claim that Benjamin Netanyahu announced plans to resettle Palestinians in Gaza to Ukraine and Syria during his April 2025 visit to the White House. While the visit did occur, and discussions about Gaza were ongoing, no sources mention such a plan.

`false`


## Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The claim is false. While Benjamin Netanyahu met with Donald Trump at the White House in April 2025, as reported by NPR ([https://www.npr.org/2025/07/07/g-s1-76296/israel-netanyahu-meet-trump](https://www.npr.org/2025/07/07/g-s1-76296/israel-netanyahu-meet-trump)) and ABC7 ([https://abc7.com/post/trump-netanyahu-may-take-victory-lap-iran-gaza-war-looms-meeting/17007239/](https://abc7.com/post/trump-netanyahu-may-take-victory-lap-iran-gaza-war-looms-meeting/17007239/)), there is no evidence from the provided sources to support the claim that he announced plans to resettle Palestinians in Gaza to Ukraine and Syria.

PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `reverse_search`
   * Description: Performs a reverse image search to find similar images on the web.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will perform a reverse search to find similar images.
   * Format: reverse_search(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `geolocate`
   * Description: Performs geolocation to determine the country where an image was taken.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will determine the most likely countries where it was taken.
   * Format: geolocate(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

# Example: reverse_search()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a rare event of a solar eclipse with a double ring."

...

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:k>)
```

# Example: geolocate()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a nuclear weapons facility in Usbekistan."

...

## Actions
```
geolocate(<image:k>)
```

# Example: web_search()

## Claim
Text: "New Zealand’s new Food Bill bans gardening"
Claim date: October 29, 2020

...

## Actions
```
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill 2020")
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

The Cartoon Depicting Zelenskyy Lying in a Coffin Was Not Published by “Charlie Hebdo”
======================================================================================

[მითების დეტექტორი](https://mythdetector.com/en/author/mithebis-deteqtori/)

[April 8, 2025 15:51](https://mythdetector.com/en/2025/04/)

Reading Time: 3 minutes

**Reading Time: 3 minutes**

!Charlie Hebdo <image:5802>

610

VIEWS

Between March 20 and 28, [Georgian](https://www.facebook.com/photo.php?fbid=9156480654478463&set=pb.100003498593222.-2207520000&type=3)
 and Russian-language Facebook accounts ([1,](https://www.facebook.com/mamikinslv/posts/pfbid0skD1WLEgTs4bf5btditeBztJtP6pMGFw6z7cqSuEAGDndDk3x9m8AFg8nAySjN1Pl)
 [2,](https://www.facebook.com/y.dudkin/posts/pfbid0pS79ic21cyXte8jQ3q72G8cPJByFxAZGgJKYa1m96r9EpRo2sizTkWxCDEeFFdB9l)
 [3,](https://www.facebook.com/groups/rusaus/posts/3984853431752407/)
 [4](https://www.facebook.com/lyudmila.danilenko.79/posts/pfbid02DCg8bGGoU9DyyGHuXxUYcEyPE3yVL7uyAHdGFDhXiFWU74qtrxwTLF8HtMQZ46mEl)
) circulated a [photo](https://www.facebook.com/permalink.php?story_fbid=pfbid02d6zKMAX22hEcqKiVGuVv1yFBQrwD2EWjWp3oestz1zxJtjjkiYiCXTMcnnDdpfVml&id=100000766903307)
 claiming to be the cover of a weekly issue of the satirical magazine Charlie Hebdo. According to the alleged cover, the Ukrainian president says from the coffin, “Ukraine is an independent state.” The image also includes a date – March 20, 2025 – as the release date of the magazine issue.

[![Charlie Hebdo](https://mythdetector.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/Screenshot-2025-04-08-154411.png "Screenshot 2025 04 08 154411 | mythdetector.com")](https://mythdetector.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/Screenshot-2025-04-08-154411.png)
 [![Charlie Hebdo](https://mythdetector.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/Screenshot-2025-04-08-154415.png "Screenshot 2025 04 08 154415 | mythdetector.com")](https://mythdetector.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/Screenshot-2025-04-08-154415.png)

**A fake Charlie Hebdo cover is being spread on Facebook. Notably, in March 2025, the magazine [released](https://charliehebdo.fr/editions/)
 four issues – March 5, 12, 19, and 26 – with covers that were entirely different from the image circulating on Facebook. The photo circulated on Facebook features a serial number of the issue – 1705, which [matches](https://charliehebdo.fr/editions/1705/)
 the actual issue published on March 26.

[![Charlie Hebdo](https://mythdetector.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/Screenshot-2025-04-08-154422.png "Screenshot 2025 04 08 154422 | mythdetector.com")](https://mythdetector.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/Screenshot-2025-04-08-154422.png)

__The date and issue number on the circulated_ [_image_](https://www.open.online/2025/03/25/falsa-copertina-charlie-hebdo-zelensky-bara-diffusa-soloviev-fc/)
_

[![Charlie Hebdo](https://mythdetector.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/Screenshot-2025-04-08-154435.png "Screenshot 2025 04 08 154435 | mythdetector.com")](https://mythdetector.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/Screenshot-2025-04-08-154435.png)

__The_ [_covers_](https://charliehebdo.fr/editions/1705/)
 _of the last 12 issues published by Charlie Hebdo__

The circulated photo was fact-checked by the Italian fact-checking organizations [Open](https://www.open.online/2025/03/25/falsa-copertina-charlie-hebdo-zelensky-bara-diffusa-soloviev-fc/)
 and [Facta](https://www.facta.news/antibufale/charlie-hebdo-copertina-zelensky-bara?fbclid=IwZXh0bgNhZW0CMTAAAR40YWY72Lf1rTjvMyKLM0Y3ZndgJYwcJdZniF6QNeHY5WACn61BzKSVdwrqnA_aem_ZXNJFBee6KvfZO9r4OIHdQ)
. Myths Detector has identified [many](https://mythdetector.com/en/fabricated-caricature-of-charlie-hebdo-about-the-missile-that-fell-in-poland/)
 similar [cases](https://mythdetector.com/en/a-fabricated-cover-of-charlie-hebdo-related-to-ukraine-s-peace-formula/)
, among which several [Charlie](https://mythdetector.com/en/fabricated-cover-charlie-hebdo-disseminated/)
 Hebdo [covers](https://mythdetector.com/en/a-fabricated-caricature-about-a-ukrainian-fencer-circulated-under-the-name-of-charlie-hebdo/)
 appear.

*   [Fabricated Covers of “Charlie Hebdo” about Ukraine](https://mythdetector.com/en/fabricated-covers-of-charlie-hebdo-about-ukraine/)
    
*   [How does Kremlin Propaganda Fabricate the Covers of Western Outlets to Discredit Ukraine?](https://mythdetector.com/en/how-does-kremlin-propaganda-fabricate-the-covers-of-western-outlets-to-discredit-ukraine/)
    
*   [Another Fabricated Caricature of Zelenskyy in the Name of Charlie Hebdo](https://mythdetector.com/en/another-fabricated-caricature-of-zelenskyy-in-the-name-of-charlie-hebdo/)
    
*   [The Cover of Charlie Hebdo, where Zelenskyy Steals Christmas, is Fabricated](https://mythdetector.com/en/the-cover-of-charlie-hebdo-where-zelenskyy-steals-christmas-is-fabricated/)
    

Archive: [1,](https://web.archive.org/web/20250408074305/https://www.facebook.com/plugins/post.php?href=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.facebook.com%2Fy.dudkin%2Fposts%2Fpfbid0pS79ic21cyXte8jQ3q72G8cPJByFxAZGgJKYa1m96r9EpRo2sizTkWxCDEeFFdB9l)
 [2,](https://archive.ph/TkAiN)
 [3,](https://archive.ph/ChJ69)
 [4](https://archive.ph/wQUdZ)

* * *

The article has been written in the framework of Facebook’s fact-checking [program](https://www.facebook.com/journalismproject/programs/third-party-fact-checking)
. 
Read detailed appeal [instructions](https://mythdetector.com/en/page/dispute-rating)
.

Topic: [Politics](https://mythdetector.com/en/topic/politics/)

Violation: [Visual manipulation](https://mythdetector.com/en/violation/visual-manipulation/)

Country: [Ukraine](https://mythdetector.com/en/country/ukraine/)

Tags: [Charlie Hebdo](https://mythdetector.com/en/tag/charlie-hebdo-en/)
[Photofabrication](https://mythdetector.com/en/tag/photofabrication/)
[Владимир Зеленский](https://mythdetector.com/en/tag/vladimir-zelenskij-en/)

 [! The image shows a deceased Volodymyr Zelenskyy lying in a coffin with inscriptions in French. Consequently, the alleged issue date is also falsified, as the satirical magazine did not publish any issue on March 20."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The search result from Myth Detector, published on April 8, 2025, fact-checks a fabricated Charlie Hebdo cover depicting Zelenskyy in a coffin. <image:5802> The article states that the magazine did not publish an issue on March 20, 2025, and the image is a fabrication. The article also mentions that the image was circulating on Facebook between March 20 and 28, 2025. The article provides links to the actual covers of Charlie Hebdo from March 2025. The article is written in the framework of Facebook’s fact-checking program.

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

A post [shared on Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/domenico.farina.31/posts/10223728579482001)
 claims to show a Charlie Hebdo magazine cover of Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy.

**Verdict: False**

There is no evidence that this image was created by the magazine. It is fake.

**Fact Check:**

Social media users are claiming to show a Charlie Hebdo magazine cover of Zelenskyy in a coffin. **[(RELATED: Is Elon Musk Paying The Salaries Of The Rescued Astronauts For A ‘Full Year?’)](https://checkyourfact.com/2025/03/24/fact-check-musk-paying-salaries-rescued-astronauts-full-year/)
**

“The political corpse emits its last gas’: a new illustration by the French political magazine Charlie Hebdo. A wider search of the [magazine’s website](https://charliehebdo.fr/)
 also did not yield any results for this claim.

[Martin Lom](https://charliehebdo.fr/auteurs/martin-lom/)
, a Charlie Hebdo journalist, told [Logically Facts](https://www.logicallyfacts.com/en/fact-check/charlie-hebdo-magazine-cover-featuring-zelenskyy-in-a-coffin-is-fake)
 that the image is fake.

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)

* advertisements

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:14> This image shows a screenshot of an authentic Charlie Hebdo magazine cover from March 20, 2025 illustrating Ukrainian President Volodoymr Zelenskyy lying in a coffin and saying 'Ukraine is an independet state' in French."

```
web_search("Charlie Hebdo March 20 2025 Zelenskyy coffin")
```

# Search Result
From [Source](https://without-lie.info/en/fake-with-another-fictional-cover-of-charlie-hebdo-magazine-with-a-caricature-of-the-president-of-ukraine/): 
Content: "This is stated in the information on the publication’s website.

Thus, the fake cover allegedly contains the magazine’s release date – March 20, 2025 and the serial number of the magazine – 1705.

[![](//i0.wp.com/without-lie.ams3.digitaloceanspaces.com/home/dr343163/without-lie.info/www/anh2-1.jpg?resize=708%2C593&ssl=1)](//i0.wp.com/without-lie.ams3.digitaloceanspaces.com/home/dr343163/without-lie.info/www/anh2-1.jpg?ssl=1)

However, Charlie Hebdo did not publish a magazine on March 20 with such a number. It was falsified based on the real cover of the publication, which was published on March 19, 2025.

In terms of content, this fake is aimed at humiliating and discrediting the Ukrainian president, who allegedly has no political future, and his dreams of an independent Ukraine are unattainable.

[Олександр Гороховський](/au/olexander/ "Олександр Гороховський")
23.03.2025

 [Twitter](//twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Fake%20with%20another%20fictional%20cover%20of%20Charlie%20Hebdo%20magazine%20with%20a%20caricature%20of%20the%20President%20of%20Ukraine&url=https://without-lie.info/?p=46618&via=@Bez_Brehni "Twitter")
 [WhatsApp](//api.whatsapp.com/send?text=Fake%20with%20another%20fictional%20cover%20of%20Charlie%20Hebdo%20magazine%20with%20a%20caricature%20of%20the%20President%20of%20Ukraine%20https://without-lie.info/?p=46618 "WhatsApp")
 [Telegram](//telegram.me/share/url?url=https://without-lie.info/?p=46618&text=Fake%20with%20another%20fictional%20cover%20of%20Charlie%20Hebdo%20magazine%20with%20a%20caricature%20of%20the%20President%20of%20Ukraine "Telegram")

**Russian propaganda continues to exploit the topic of fake covers of Western publications, which mock Ukraine or the Ukrainian leadership in the form of caricatures. This time, the cover of Charlie Hebdo magazine has been falsified.

[![](//i0.wp.com/without-lie.ams3.digitaloceanspaces.com/home/dr343163/without-lie.info/www/shar2-3.jpg?resize=708%2C592&ssl=1)](//i0.wp.com/without-lie.ams3.digitaloceanspaces.com/home/dr343163/without-lie.info/www/shar2-3.jpg?ssl=1)

The cover, which was distributed by Russian propaganda Telegram channels, depicts a caricature of Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky, who is allegedly lying in a coffin. 1704 for March 19, 2025 ([https://surl.li/qgqsaf](//surl.li/qgqsaf)
). So, the previous 1703rd issue was published on March 12, 2025 ([https://surl.li/srmwfu](//surl.li/srmwfu)
), and the 1702nd – on March 5, 2025 ([https://surli.cc/tefpcg](//surli.cc/tefpcg)
).

[![](//i0.wp.com/without-lie.ams3.digitaloceanspaces.com/home/dr343163/without-lie.info/www/shar3-2.jpg?resize=708%2C417&ssl=1)](//i0.wp.com/without-lie.ams3.digitaloceanspaces.com/home/dr343163/without-lie.info/www/shar3-2.jpg?ssl=1)

In addition, the upcoming issue of the magazine cannot contain a caricature of the president of Ukraine either – both the original cover and the fake one have an image of the announcement of the next issue of the magazine and its cover in the upper corner. For example, the other day, the cover of the French humorous publication Charlie Hebdo actively went viral in the Russian segment of Telegram – such a post was spread by one of the top Russian propaganda channels “Ukropsky Fresh” ([https://surl.li/kcqnza](//surl.li/kcqnza)
), the anti-Ukrainian resource “Drugaya Ukraina” ([https://surli.cc/blivly](//surli.cc/blivly)
), as well as the Kremlin’s top propagandist Solovyov ([https://surl.li/ksrqfa](//surl.li/ksrqfa)
). The cover contains a humiliating inscription, namely: “A political corpse is taking its last breath,” and the phrase “Ukraine is an independent state” is supposedly flying from the image of Zelensky himself.

However, Charlie Hebdo did not publish such an issue of the magazine with such a cover. And it has a completely different picture.

Accordingly, it can be stated that the publication in Russian Telegram channels of the cover of Charlie Hebdo magazine with a caricature of Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky is a fake."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The search result from without-lie.info states that the Charlie Hebdo cover featuring Zelenskyy in a coffin is a fake. The article mentions the release date of the fake cover as March 20, 2025, with the serial number 1705. <image:14> The article also provides an image of the fake cover and states that the real cover was published on March 19, 2025. The article was published on March 23, 2025, and authored by Олександр Гороховський.

_________________________



SummarizeSummariesPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved web sources, each one summarized under "Web Sources". **Your task right now is to summarize the web source summaries.**

Always adhere to the following rules:
* Write only one to two paragraphs.
* Include all URLs from the listed sources. Format them as Markdown hyperlinks.
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the summaries.
* Include references (<image:k>) to all relevant images.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:14> This image shows a screenshot of an authentic Charlie Hebdo magazine cover from March 20, 2025 illustrating Ukrainian President Volodoymr Zelenskyy lying in a coffin and saying 'Ukraine is an independet state' in French."

## Actions
```
web_search("Charlie Hebdo March 20 2025 Zelenskyy coffin")
```

## Web Sources
**Web Search Result**

From [Source](https://mythdetector.com/en/coffin-was-not-published-by-charlie-hebdo/): 
Content: The search result from Myth Detector, published on April 8, 2025, fact-checks a fabricated Charlie Hebdo cover depicting Zelenskyy in a coffin. <image:5802> The article states that the magazine did not publish an issue on March 20, 2025, and the image is a fabrication. The article also mentions that the image was circulating on Facebook between March 20 and 28, 2025. The article provides links to the actual covers of Charlie Hebdo from March 2025. The article is written in the framework of Facebook’s fact-checking program.


From [Source](https://www.aol.com/fact-check-charlie-hebdo-magazine-151901301.html): 
Content: The search result from aol.com, published on March 28, 2025, states that the Charlie Hebdo magazine cover featuring Zelenskyy in a coffin is fake. The article mentions that a Charlie Hebdo journalist confirmed the image's inauthenticity. <image:5856> The article also mentions that the magazine's website does not have the image.


From [Source](https://without-lie.info/en/fake-with-another-fictional-cover-of-charlie-hebdo-magazine-with-a-caricature-of-the-president-of-ukraine/): 
Content: The search result from without-lie.info states that the Charlie Hebdo cover featuring Zelenskyy in a coffin is a fake. The article mentions the release date of the fake cover as March 20, 2025, with the serial number 1705. <image:14> The article also provides an image of the fake cover and states that the real cover was published on March 19, 2025. The article was published on March 23, 2025, and authored by Олександр Гороховський.


## Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The search results indicate that the Charlie Hebdo cover featuring Zelenskyy in a coffin is a fabrication. Myth Detector ([Source](https://mythdetector.com/en/coffin-was-not-published-by-charlie-hebdo/)) and without-lie.info ([Source](https://without-lie.info/en/fake-with-another-fictional-cover-of-charlie-hebdo-magazine-with-a-caricature-of-the-president-of-ukraine/)) both confirm the image's inauthenticity, with the latter specifying a publication date of March 20, 2025, and serial number 1705.  Aol.com ([Source](https://www.aol.com/fact-check-charlie-hebdo-magazine-151901301.html)) also confirms the image is fake, citing confirmation from a Charlie Hebdo journalist.

The image of the fake cover is provided in the articles. <image:5802> <image:14>

DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:14> This image shows a screenshot of an authentic Charlie Hebdo magazine cover from March 20, 2025 illustrating Ukrainian President Volodoymr Zelenskyy lying in a coffin and saying 'Ukraine is an independet state' in French."

## Actions
```
web_search("Charlie Hebdo March 20 2025 Zelenskyy coffin")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The search results indicate that the Charlie Hebdo cover featuring Zelenskyy in a coffin is a fabrication. Myth Detector ([Source](https://mythdetector.com/en/coffin-was-not-published-by-charlie-hebdo/)) and without-lie.info ([Source](https://without-lie.info/en/fake-with-another-fictional-cover-of-charlie-hebdo-magazine-with-a-caricature-of-the-president-of-ukraine/)) both confirm the image's inauthenticity, with the latter specifying a publication date of March 20, 2025, and serial number 1705.  Aol.com ([Source](https://www.aol.com/fact-check-charlie-hebdo-magazine-151901301.html)) also confirms the image is fake, citing confirmation from a Charlie Hebdo journalist.

The image of the fake cover is provided in the articles. <image:5802> <image:14>


# Your Analysis



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The evidence confirms that the Charlie Hebdo cover featuring Zelenskyy in a coffin is a fabrication. Multiple sources, including Myth Detector ([https://mythdetector.com/en/coffin-was-not-published-by-charlie-hebdo/]), without-lie.info ([https://without-lie.info/en/fake-with-another-fictional-cover-of-charlie-hebdo-magazine-with-a-caricature-of-the-president-of-ukraine/]), and aol.com ([https://www.aol.com/fact-check-charlie-hebdo-magazine-151901301.html]), explicitly state the image's inauthenticity.

The sources also provide the publication date (March 20, 2025) and serial number (1705) of the fake cover. Aol.com further supports this by citing confirmation from a Charlie Hebdo journalist.

JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:14> This image shows a screenshot of an authentic Charlie Hebdo magazine cover from March 20, 2025 illustrating Ukrainian President Volodoymr Zelenskyy lying in a coffin and saying 'Ukraine is an independet state' in French."

## Actions
```
web_search("Charlie Hebdo March 20 2025 Zelenskyy coffin")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The search results indicate that the Charlie Hebdo cover featuring Zelenskyy in a coffin is a fabrication. Myth Detector ([Source](https://mythdetector.com/en/coffin-was-not-published-by-charlie-hebdo/)) and without-lie.info ([Source](https://without-lie.info/en/fake-with-another-fictional-cover-of-charlie-hebdo-magazine-with-a-caricature-of-the-president-of-ukraine/)) both confirm the image's inauthenticity, with the latter specifying a publication date of March 20, 2025, and serial number 1705.  Aol.com ([Source](https://www.aol.com/fact-check-charlie-hebdo-magazine-151901301.html)) also confirms the image is fake, citing confirmation from a Charlie Hebdo journalist.

The image of the fake cover is provided in the articles. <image:5802> <image:14>


## Elaboration
The evidence confirms that the Charlie Hebdo cover featuring Zelenskyy in a coffin is a fabrication. Multiple sources, including Myth Detector ([https://mythdetector.com/en/coffin-was-not-published-by-charlie-hebdo/]), without-lie.info ([https://without-lie.info/en/fake-with-another-fictional-cover-of-charlie-hebdo-magazine-with-a-caricature-of-the-president-of-ukraine/]), and aol.com ([https://www.aol.com/fact-check-charlie-hebdo-magazine-151901301.html]), explicitly state the image's inauthenticity.

The sources also provide the publication date (March 20, 2025) and serial number (1705) of the fake cover. Aol.com further supports this by citing confirmation from a Charlie Hebdo journalist.


# Your Judgement



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The claim is demonstrably false. Multiple reliable sources confirm that the Charlie Hebdo cover depicting Zelenskyy in a coffin is a fabrication.

`false`

SummarizeDocPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You are provided with the record of a fact-check. It contains the Claim to be verified and a documentation of all the fact-checking work along the gathered evidence. Your task is to **summarize the fact-check**. That is, you provide a concise, one-paragraph justification for the final VERDICT based on the knowledge from the Record. Note:
* Be truthful, brief, do not add any additional information besides the information given in the Record. 
* Link key sources in your summary. Use Markdown notation for that. You may link them in-line.
* Don't state the Claim again. Rather focus on the key insights of the fact-check.
* Simply print just the summary.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:14> This image shows a screenshot of an authentic Charlie Hebdo magazine cover from March 20, 2025 illustrating Ukrainian President Volodoymr Zelenskyy lying in a coffin and saying 'Ukraine is an independet state' in French."

## Actions
```
web_search("Charlie Hebdo March 20 2025 Zelenskyy coffin")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The search results indicate that the Charlie Hebdo cover featuring Zelenskyy in a coffin is a fabrication. Myth Detector ([Source](https://mythdetector.com/en/coffin-was-not-published-by-charlie-hebdo/)) and without-lie.info ([Source](https://without-lie.info/en/fake-with-another-fictional-cover-of-charlie-hebdo-magazine-with-a-caricature-of-the-president-of-ukraine/)) both confirm the image's inauthenticity, with the latter specifying a publication date of March 20, 2025, and serial number 1705.  Aol.com ([Source](https://www.aol.com/fact-check-charlie-hebdo-magazine-151901301.html)) also confirms the image is fake, citing confirmation from a Charlie Hebdo journalist.

The image of the fake cover is provided in the articles. <image:5802> <image:14>


## Elaboration
The evidence confirms that the Charlie Hebdo cover featuring Zelenskyy in a coffin is a fabrication. Multiple sources, including Myth Detector ([https://mythdetector.com/en/coffin-was-not-published-by-charlie-hebdo/]), without-lie.info ([https://without-lie.info/en/fake-with-another-fictional-cover-of-charlie-hebdo-magazine-with-a-caricature-of-the-president-of-ukraine/]), and aol.com ([https://www.aol.com/fact-check-charlie-hebdo-magazine-151901301.html]), explicitly state the image's inauthenticity.

The sources also provide the publication date (March 20, 2025) and serial number (1705) of the fake cover. Aol.com further supports this by citing confirmation from a Charlie Hebdo journalist.


## Final Judgement
The claim is demonstrably false. Multiple reliable sources confirm that the Charlie Hebdo cover depicting Zelenskyy in a coffin is a fabrication.

`false`

## Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The image of the Charlie Hebdo cover featuring Zelenskyy in a coffin is a fabrication, as confirmed by multiple fact-checking sources, including Myth Detector ([https://mythdetector.com/en/coffin-was-not-published-by-charlie-hebdo/]), without-lie.info ([https://without-lie.info/en/fake-with-another-fictional-cover-of-charlie-hebdo-magazine-with-a-caricature-of-the-president-of-ukraine/]), and aol.com ([https://www.aol.com/fact-check-charlie-hebdo-magazine-151901301.html]).

PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `reverse_search`
   * Description: Performs a reverse image search to find similar images on the web.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will perform a reverse search to find similar images.
   * Format: reverse_search(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `geolocate`
   * Description: Performs geolocation to determine the country where an image was taken.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will determine the most likely countries where it was taken.
   * Format: geolocate(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

# Example: reverse_search()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a rare event of a solar eclipse with a double ring."

...

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:k>)
```

# Example: geolocate()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a nuclear weapons facility in Usbekistan."

...

## Actions
```
geolocate(<image:k>)
```

# Example: web_search()

## Claim
Text: "New Zealand’s new Food Bill bans gardening"
Claim date: October 29, 2020

...

## Actions
```
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill 2020")
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```

# Record

===== > RESPONSE:  < =====

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

):  

Should have never started. If I were president, this would've never started.

Speaker 2 ([14:06](https://www.rev.com/transcript-editor/shared/ec0OtVZh9a2rKngAEQ_YDIxAGywaYi5fCFILTGFFQBbPm5I30_3kG2qZjIfOFAPgELAaBB10AdnkETtmr2NqdvoDeQM?loadFrom=PastedDeeplink&ts=846)
):  

Will you continue sending military aid to Ukraine after the US signs this agreement with Ukraine?

President Donald Trump ([14:18](https://www.rev.com/transcript-editor/shared/ec0OtVZh9a2rKngAEQ_YDIxAGywaYi5fCFILTGFFQBbPm5I30_3kG2qZjIfOFAPgELAaBB10AdnkETtmr2NqdvoDeQM?loadFrom=PastedDeeplink&ts=858.09)
):  

Yeah, we're going to be continuing-

Speaker 2 ([14:19](https://www.rev.com/transcript-editor/shared/ec0OtVZh9a2rKngAEQ_YDIxAGywaYi5fCFILTGFFQBbPm5I30_3kG2qZjIfOFAPgELAaBB10AdnkETtmr2NqdvoDeQM?loadFrom=PastedDeeplink&ts=859.71)
):  

And a question to President Zelenskyy."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The search result is a transcript of a meeting between Trump and Zelenskyy in the Oval Office. The transcript includes discussions about the war, military aid, and the relationship between the two countries.

# Search Result
From [Source](https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/feb/28/trump-zelenskyy-meeting-transcript): 
Content: "[Skip to main content](#maincontent)
[Skip to navigation](#navigation)
[Skip to navigation](#navigation)

!Man shows other man pictures of prisoners of war <image:2209>

3:20

'Make a deal or we are out': the worst of Trump and Zelenskyy’s clash – video

This article is more than **5 months old**

[Explainer](/tone/explainers)

Trump’s explosive clash with Zelenskyy: read the full transcript
================================================================

This article is more than 5 months old

Meeting between US and Ukraine presidents descends into chaos at White House – here’s what they said, word for word

A meeting between [Donald Trump](https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/donaldtrump)
 and [Volodymyr Zelenskyy](https://www.theguardian.com/world/volodymyr-zelenskiy)
 veered sharply off track in front of the television cameras as the US president [berated his Ukrainian counterpart](https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/feb/28/trump-zelenskyy-meeting-ukraine-aid-war)
 then abruptly called off a minerals deal with that he had said would be the first step towards a ceasefire with Russia.

Here are the highlights, word-for-word, of the conversation between Trump, Zelenskyy and Vice-President [JD Vance](https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/jd-vance)
 in the Oval Office.

**Zelenskyy**: What kind of diplomacy, JD, are you are asking about? I will say that.

Explore more on these topics

*   [Donald Trump](/us-news/donaldtrump)
    
*   [US politics](/us-news/us-politics)
    
*   [Ukraine](/world/ukraine)
    
*   [Russia](/world/russia)
    
*   [Volodymyr Zelenskyy](/world/volodymyr-zelenskiy)
    
*   [Europe](/world/europe-news)
    
*   [JD Vance](/us-news/jd-vance)
    
*   [explainers](/tone/explainers)
    

[Share](mailto:?subject=Trump’s explosive clash with Zelenskyy: read the full transcript&body=https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/feb/28/trump-zelenskyy-meeting-transcript?CMP=share_btn_url)

[Reuse this content](https://syndication.theguardian.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.theguardian.com%2Fus-news%2F2025%2Ffeb%2F28%2Ftrump-zelenskyy-meeting-transcript&type=article&internalpagecode=us-news/2025/feb/28/trump-zelenskyy-meeting-transcript "Reuse this content")

Most viewed
-----------

Most viewed
----------- Don’t tell us what we’re going to feel.

**Zelenskyy**: I am not telling you, I am answering …

[Ukraine ‘gambling with world war three’, Trump tells Zelenskyy in fiery meeting\
\
Read more](https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/feb/28/trump-zelenskyy-meeting-ukraine-aid-war)

**Vance**: That’s exactly what you’re doing …

**Trump, raising his voice**: You’re in no position to dictate what we’re going to feel. We’re going to feel very good and very strong.

_Zelenskyy tries to_ _speak._

**Trump**: You right now are not in a very good position. With us, you start having the cards.

You’re gambling with lives of millions of people, you’re gambling with world war three and what you’re doing is very disrespectful to this country.

**Vance**: Have you said thank you once?

**Zelenskyy**: A lot of times.

**Vance**: No, in this meeting, this entire meeting? Offer some words of appreciation for the United States of America and the president who’s trying to save your country.

**Zelenskyy**: Yes, you think that if you will speak very loudly about the war …

**Trump**: He’s not speaking loud. Your country is in big trouble.

**Zelenskyy**: I know, I know.

**Trump**: You’re not winning this. You have a damn good chance of coming out OK, because of us.

**Zelenskyy**: We are staying strong from the very beginning of the war, we have been alone, and we are saying, I said, thanks.

**Trump, speaking over Zelenskyy**: You haven’t been alone … We gave you military equipment. If you didn’t have our military equipment, this war would have been over in two weeks.

**Zelenskyy**: I heard it from Putin in three days.

**Trump**: It’s going to be a very hard thing to do business like this.

**Vance**: Just say thank you.

**Zelenskyy**: I said it a lot of times.

**Vance**: Accept that there are disagreements and let’s go litigate those disagreements rather than trying to fight it in the American media, when you’re wrong. What do you mean?

**Vance**: I’m talking about the kind of diplomacy that’s going to end the destruction of your country.

**Zelenskyy**: Yes, but if you …

**Vance**: Mr President, with respect, I think it’s disrespectful for you to come to the Oval Office and try to litigate this in front of the American media."

# Search Result
From [Source](https://en.wikisource.org/wiki/Transcript_of_the_2025_Trump%E2%80%93Zelenskyy_meeting): 
Content: "[Jump to content](#bodyContent)

[Download](https://ws-export.wmcloud.org/?format=epub&lang=en&page=Transcript_of_the_2025_Trump%E2%80%93Zelenskyy_meeting "Download an EPUB version of this work")

From Wikisource

←

Transcript of the 2025 Trump–Zelenskyy meeting (2025)

→

*   [![Related Portals](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4c/Wikisource-logo.svg/20px-Wikisource-logo.svg.png)](/wiki/Portal:Portals "Portal:Portals")
    [related portals](/wiki/Portal:Portals "Portal:Portals")
    : [Russo-Ukrainian War](/w/index.php?title=Portal:Russo-Ukrainian_War&action=edit&redlink=1 "Portal:Russo-Ukrainian War (page does not exist)")
    
*   [![Sister Projects](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/81/Wikimedia-logo.svg/20px-Wikimedia-logo.svg.png)](/wiki/Special:SiteMatrix "Special:SiteMatrix")
    [sister projects](/wiki/Special:SiteMatrix "Special:SiteMatrix")
    : [Wikidata item](https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q132976516 "d:Q132976516")
    

This transcript covers the last 10 decisive minutes of the 50 minutes [Trump–Zelenskyy meeting](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/en:2025_Trump%E2%80%93Zelenskyy_meeting "w:en:2025 Trump–Zelenskyy meeting")
 on February 28, 2025 (11 a.m.) in the Oval Office. The talking participants were US President [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/en:Donald_Trump "w:en:Donald Trump")
, US Vice President [JD Vance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/en:JD_Vance "w:en:JD Vance")
, and Ukraine's President [Volodymyr Zelenskyy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/en:Volodymyr_Zelenskyy "w:en:Volodymyr Zelenskyy")
, as well as members of the press.

4764238Transcript of the 2025 Trump–Zelenskyy meeting2025

Full video of the meeting (transcript starts at 43:20)

Vance: “For four years, the United States of America, we had a president ([Joe Biden](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/en:Joe_Biden "w:en:Joe Biden")
) who stood up at press conferences and talked tough about [Vladimir Putin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/en:Vladimir_Putin "w:en:Vladimir Putin")
, and then Putin [invaded Ukraine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/en:Russian_invasion_of_Ukraine "w:en:Russian invasion of Ukraine")
 and destroyed a significant chunk of the country. Thank you.”

Retrieved from "[https://en.wikisource.org/w/index.php?title=Transcript\_of\_the\_2025\_Trump–Zelenskyy\_meeting&oldid=14992396](https://en.wikisource.org/w/index.php?title=Transcript_of_the_2025_Trump–Zelenskyy_meeting&oldid=14992396)
"

1 language [Add topic](#) That’s what President Trump is doing.”

Zelenskyy: “Can I ask you?”

Vance: “Sure. You know what the contact line —"

Trump: “2015?”

Zelenskyy: “2014.”

Trump: “Oh, 2014? You don’t know that.”

Zelenskyy: “...god bless, you are not in a war.”

Trump: “Don’t tell us what we’re going to feel. We’re going to feel very good.”

Zelenskyy: “You will feel influenced.”

Trump: “We are going to feel very good and very strong.”

Zelenskyy: “I am telling you. You’ve allowed yourself to be in a very bad position –”

Zelenskyy: “From the very beginning of the war—”

Trump: “You’re not in a good position. You’re gambling with World War III!”

Zelenskyy: “What are you speaking about?”

Trump: “You’re gambling with World War III! Your country is in big trouble.”

Zelenskyy: “Can I answer?”

Trump: “No, no."

## Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The search results provide transcripts of a meeting between Donald Trump and Volodymyr Zelenskyy. One source is a transcript of a meeting in the Oval Office, discussing the war and military aid ([https://www.rev.com/transcripts/trump-and-zelenskyy-in-the-oval-office](https://www.rev.com/transcripts/trump-and-zelenskyy-in-the-oval-office)). Another source, from The Guardian, details a meeting on February 28, 2025, where Trump berated Zelenskyy and called off a minerals deal ([https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/feb/28/trump-zelenskyy-meeting-transcript](https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/feb/28/trump-zelenskyy-meeting-transcript)).

A third source is a transcript of the 2025 Trump–Zelenskyy meeting on February 28, 2025, in the Oval Office, including Donald Trump, JD Vance, and Volodymyr Zelenskyy ([https://en.wikisource.org/wiki/Transcript_of_the_2025_Trump%E2%80%93Zelenskyy_meeting](https://en.wikisource.org/wiki/Transcript_of_the_2025_Trump%E2%80%93Zelenskyy_meeting)). The transcript covers the last 10 minutes of the meeting, and includes the exchange shown in <image:15>. The Guardian article also includes an image of the meeting <image:2209>.

# Search Result
From [Source](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Trump%E2%80%93Ukraine_scandal): 
Content: "Contacts were established between the White House and [government of Ukraine](/wiki/Government_of_Ukraine "Government of Ukraine")
, culminating in a [call between Trump and Zelenskyy](/wiki/2019_Trump%E2%80%93Zelenskyy_call "2019 Trump–Zelenskyy call")
 on July 25, 2019.[\[1\]](#cite_note-involved_pence-1)
[\[2\]](#cite_note-trump_pressed-2)
[\[3\]](#cite_note-Baker-3)
[\[6\]](#cite_note-TextMsg-6)

Trump released the aid after becoming aware of a [whistleblower](/wiki/Whistleblower_protection_in_the_United_States "Whistleblower protection in the United States")
 complaint made in August 2019, before the complaint was known by Congress or the public.[\[7\]](#cite_note-trump_knew-7)
 The scandal reached public attention in mid-September 2019.[\[8\]](#cite_note-timeline-8)
 The complaint raised concerns about Trump using powers to solicit [foreign electoral intervention](/wiki/Foreign_electoral_intervention "Foreign electoral intervention")
 in the [2020 U.S. A transcript of the Trump–Zelenskyy call confirmed Trump requested investigations into Joe Biden and his son [Hunter Biden](/wiki/Hunter_Biden "Hunter Biden")
, as well as a [conspiracy theory involving a Democratic National Committee server](/wiki/Conspiracy_theories_related_to_the_Trump%E2%80%93Ukraine_scandal "Conspiracy theories related to the Trump–Ukraine scandal")
, while urging Zelenskyy to work with Giuliani and Barr on this.[\[10\]](#cite_note-Bump27-10)
[\[11\]](#cite_note-helderman-11)

Former acting chief of staff [Mick Mulvaney](/wiki/Mick_Mulvaney "Mick Mulvaney")
 said one reason why Trump withheld aid to Ukraine was Ukrainian "corruption related to the DNC server", referring to a debunked theory that Ukrainians framed Russia for [hacking into the DNC](/wiki/2016_Democratic_National_Committee_email_leak "2016 Democratic National Committee email leak")
 system.[\[12\]](#cite_note-becket-12)
 Trump has publicly urged Ukraine and China to investigate the Bidens.[\[13\]](#cite_note-tremendous-13)
 The Trump administration's top diplomat to Ukraine, [Bill Taylor](/wiki/William_B._Taylor_Jr. Taylor Jr.")
, testified he was told aid to Ukraine and a Trump–Zelenskyy White House meeting were conditional on Zelenskyy announcing investigations into the Bidens and alleged Ukrainian interference in the 2016 U.S. While Trump’s acquittal spared him legal penalties, the episode remains a significant case study in the limits of constitutional checks on presidential authority, particularly in an era of intense political polarization.

Background
----------

Main article: [2019 Trump–Zelenskyy phone call](/wiki/2019_Trump%E2%80%93Zelenskyy_phone_call "2019 Trump–Zelenskyy phone call")

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9c/Volodymyr_Zelensky_Official_portrait.jpg/250px-Volodymyr_Zelensky_Official_portrait.jpg)](/wiki/File:Volodymyr_Zelensky_Official_portrait.jpg)

Ukrainian president [Volodymyr Zelenskyy](/wiki/Volodymyr_Zelenskyy "Volodymyr Zelenskyy")

The scandal came to light when a [whistleblower](/wiki/Whistleblower "Whistleblower")
 report revealed that President Trump had asked Ukrainian president [Volodymyr Zelenskyy](/wiki/Volodymyr_Zelenskyy "Volodymyr Zelenskyy")
 in July 2019 to investigate [Joe Biden](/wiki/Joe_Biden "Joe Biden")
, Trump's political opponent in the [2020 presidential election](/wiki/2020_United_States_presidential_election "2020 United States presidential election")
, his son [Hunter Biden](/wiki/Hunter_Biden "Hunter Biden")
, and company [CrowdStrike](/wiki/CrowdStrike "CrowdStrike")
, to discuss these matters with Trump's personal attorney [Rudy Giuliani](/wiki/Rudy_Giuliani "Rudy Giuliani")
 and Attorney General [William Barr](/wiki/William_Barr "William Barr")
.[\[22\]](#cite_note-urged-22)
[\[23\]](#cite_note-23)
 The allegations were confirmed by a non-verbatim summary of the conversation released by the White House.[\[10\]](#cite_note-Bump27-10)
[\[11\]](#cite_note-helderman-11)
[\[24\]](#cite_note-press_secretary-24)
 Trump acknowledged he had told Zelenskyy "we don't want our people like Vice President Biden and his son \[contributing\] to the corruption already in the Ukraine."[\[25\]](#cite_note-trump_acknowledges-25)
 According to the whistleblower, the call was part of a wider campaign by Trump, his administration, and Giuliani to pressure Ukraine into investigating the Bidens, which may have included Trump's cancelling a scheduled trip to Ukraine by Vice President [Mike Pence](/wiki/Mike_Pence "Mike Pence")
, and Trump withholding $400 million in military aid from Ukraine.[\[26\]](#cite_note-Balsamo-190926-26)
[\[27\]](#cite_note-auto2-27)
[\[28\]](#cite_note-28)

Immediately after the Trump–Zelenskyy call ended, White House national security aides discussed their deep concerns, with at least one [National Security Council](/wiki/United_States_National_Security_Council "United States National Security Council")
 (NSC) official alerting White House national security lawyers.[\[29\]](#cite_note-cnn-oct8-29)
[\[30\]](#cite_note-raised_alarms-30)
 A text message between a State Department envoy to Ukraine and a Ukrainian official showed the envoy understood from the White House that a Zelenskyy visit with Trump was contingent upon Ukraine's investigating [a conspiracy theory about alleged Ukrainian meddling](/wiki/Conspiracy_theories_related_to_the_Trump%E2%80%93Ukraine_scandal "Conspiracy theories related to the Trump–Ukraine scandal")
 in the [2016 U.S. On May 7, Zelenskyy and a group of his advisors had a three-hour meeting to discuss how to respond to Trump and Giuliani's pressure and how to avoid becoming involved in domestic American politics.[\[90\]](#cite_note-pressure-90)
 Giuliani said the investigations he sought would be beneficial to President Trump, his client, and that his efforts had Trump's full support.[\[91\]](#cite_note-plans_trip-91)
 Giuliani's efforts began as an attempt to provide cover for Trump to pardon Manafort, who had been [convicted of eight felony counts](/wiki/Trials_of_Paul_Manafort "Trials of Paul Manafort")
 in August 2018.[\[92\]](#cite_note-92)

On May 10, Giuliani canceled a scheduled trip to Ukraine where he had intended to urge president-elect Zelenskyy to pursue inquiries into Hunter Biden, as well as whether Democrats colluded with Ukrainians to release information about Manafort.[\[93\]](#cite_note-93)
[\[94\]](#cite_note-WaPo_How_Trump_pressured-94)
 Giuliani claimed he has sworn statements from five Ukrainians stating they were brought into the Obama White House in January 2016 and told to "go dig up dirt on Trump and Manafort", although he has not produced evidence for the claim.[\[95\]](#cite_note-CNBC-eight-times-95)
 Giuliani asserted he cancelled the trip because he had been "set up" by Ukrainians who objected to his efforts, and blamed Democrats for trying to "spin" the trip. On this call, Giuliani said that if Zelenskyy were to publicly announce an investigation into Biden, it would help Zelenskyy have "a much better relationship" with Trump.[\[98\]](#cite_note-new_audio-98)

Responding to a motion by the liberal watchdog group [American Oversight](/wiki/American_Oversight "American Oversight")
,[\[99\]](#cite_note-new_documents-99)
 on October 23 a federal judge gave the State Department 30 days to release Ukraine-related records, including communications between [Secretary of State](/wiki/United_States_Secretary_of_State "United States Secretary of State")
 [Mike Pompeo](/wiki/Mike_Pompeo "Mike Pompeo")
 and Rudy Giuliani.[\[100\]](#cite_note-100)
 On November 22, the State Department released internal emails and documents that bolstered Gordon Sondland's congressional testimony that Pompeo participated in Giuliani's activities relating to Ukraine. Ambassador to Ukraine, was removed from her post because of her anti-corruption efforts in Ukraine, and because she disagreed with the [shadow diplomacy](/wiki/State_within_a_state "State within a state")
 taking place under Giuliani and President Trump.

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9e/Chairmen-letter-on-state-departmnent-texts-10-03-19.pdf/page1-150px-Chairmen-letter-on-state-departmnent-texts-10-03-19.pdf.jpg)](/wiki/File:Chairmen-letter-on-state-departmnent-texts-10-03-19.pdf)

Letter from the chairs of the House Committees on Intelligence, Oversight and Reform, and Foreign Affairs, including copies of text-message conversations involving Volker, Sondland, and others

On September 20, 2019, _[The Washington Post](/wiki/The_Washington_Post "The Washington Post")
_ reported that Trump had in a July 25 phone conversation repeatedly pressed Ukrainian president Zelenskyy to investigate matters relating to [Hunter Biden](/wiki/Hunter_Biden "Hunter Biden")
.[\[173\]](#cite_note-173)
 _[The New York Times](/wiki/The_New_York_Times "The New York Times")
_ reported that Trump told Zelenskyy to speak to Giuliani,[\[174\]](#cite_note-174)
[\[175\]](#cite_note-175)
 and according to _The Wall Street Journal_, he urged Zelenskyy "about eight times" to work with Giuliani and investigate Biden's son.[\[96\]](#cite_note-repeatedly-96)
 On September 22, Trump acknowledged he had discussed Joe Biden during the call with Zelenskyy, and that he had said: "We don't want our people like Vice President Biden and his son creating \[_[sic](/wiki/Sic "Sic")\
_\] to the corruption already in the Ukraine. president aide) (page does not exist)")
, an aide to [Mick Mulvaney](/wiki/Mick_Mulvaney "Mick Mulvaney")
; and [Alexander Vindman](/wiki/Alexander_Vindman "Alexander Vindman")
, a Ukraine expert for the NSC.[\[29\]](#cite_note-cnn-oct8-29)

Days before Trump's July 25 call with Zelenskyy, Giuliani spoke on the phone with Zelenskyy aide [Andriy Yermak](/wiki/Andriy_Yermak "Andriy Yermak")
 about a Biden investigation, as well as a prospective White House meeting between Zelenskyy and Trump that was sought by Ukrainian officials.[\[177\]](#cite_note-NYT_Long-Held_Trump_Grudge-177)
[\[98\]](#cite_note-new_audio-98)
 According to Zelenskyy's advisor [Serhiy Leshchenko](/wiki/Serhiy_Leshchenko "Serhiy Leshchenko")
, Trump was willing to have a phone conversation with Zelenskyy only on the precondition that they discuss the possibility of investigating the Biden family. Trump said three times that he would ask both Attorney General Barr and Giuliani to call Zelenskyy,[\[184\]](#cite_note-Timmons-185)
 and added: "So whatever you can do with the attorney general would be great."[\[180\]](#cite_note-ShearHaberman-180)
 In response, Zelenskyy said his candidate for Ukraine's chief prosecutor "will look into the situation, specifically to the company that you mentioned in this issue". After Zelenskyy said this, Trump offered to meet with Zelenskyy at the White House.[\[181\]](#cite_note-releasedWaPo-181)
 On the same call with Zelenskyy, Trump espoused the [conspiracy theory](/wiki/List_of_conspiracy_theories#Trump,_Biden,_and_Ukraine "List of conspiracy theories")
 that Hillary Clinton's email server was in Ukraine;[\[185\]](#cite_note-186)
[\[186\]](#cite_note-187)
 criticized the U.S.'s European allies (in particular [Germany](/wiki/Germany "Germany")
),[\[184\]](#cite_note-Timmons-185)
 and disparaged the former [U.S."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The search result is from Wikipedia and discusses the 2019 Trump–Ukraine scandal. It mentions a phone call between Trump and Zelenskyy on July 25, 2019, where Trump requested investigations into Joe Biden and his son Hunter Biden. The article also mentions that Trump withheld military aid from Ukraine. <image:15> shows a transcript of a meeting between Trump and Zelenskyy.

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

Content: "[](#maincontent)

Trump pauses military aid to Ukraine after Oval Office argument with Zelensky, White House official says
========================================================================================================

 [![Kevin Liptak](https://media.cnn.com/api/v1/images/stellar/prod/1418603-2213-r-20241209184842881.jpg?c=16x9&q=h_270,w_480,c_fill/c_thumb,g_face,w_100,h_100)](https://www.cnn.com/profiles/kevin-liptak-profile)
[![Samantha Waldenberg](https://media.cnn.com/api/v1/images/stellar/prod/1506450-1628-r.jpg?c=16x9&q=h_270,w_480,c_fill/c_thumb,g_face,w_100,h_100)](https://www.cnn.com/profiles/samantha-waldenberg)
